page.title: 16Farming 9 - Argoed Farm
page.content: The Arggoed consists of the farmhouse and 4 outhouses. The owner and his son, together with one employee farm 300 acres. The farm is split into 25 fields. It is rented from the Llanarth estate. Most of the acreage is used for grazing but corn is grown on 60 acres, and 12 acres are used for fodder beet. The farmer cuts the grass twice a year for silage and once for hay. He owns 134 cows. 89 of these are dairy cows but 14 are not yielding milk at present. The remainder of the cows consist of 35 heifers and 10 beef cattle. The cows are milked twice a day 6am and 5pm. Cattle are bought and sold at the Abergavenny and Monmouth markets. Access to either is easy via the A40.
